content.text: abKey The tabKey command opens the first unlocked field on the current card or background (placing the insertion point in the field) and selects its entire contents. If a field is already open for editing, tabKey closes it and opens the next editable field, selecting its contents. (A field is editable only if it is unlocked and visible.)

he tabKey command opens fields in the following order: from the lowest to the highest numbered background field, then from the lowest to the highest numbered card field. HyperCard sends the tabKey command to a field or the current card when the user presses the Tab key. You can handle the tabKey message as follows: on tabKey statements end tabKey

on mouseUp -- Selects the text of the first unlocked field put the lockText of bkgnd field "Demo Script" into textLock set the lockText of bkgnd field "Demo Script" to false tabKey wait 1 second set the lockText of bkgnd field "Demo Script" to textLock end mouseUp
-- Set the insertion point in the first editable field on openCard on openCard tabKey end openCard
card messages command field messages key message tab tabKey
